memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t N_P, const VectorX< Scalar > &orbital_energies, const RTransformation< Scalar > &C)
memberdef.name: RHF

parameterdescription.para: The number of electron pairs.
The transformation that expresses the RHF MOs in terms of the atomic spinors.
The RHF MO energies.

detaileddescription.para: Default constructor setting everything to zero.

simplesect.para: A matrix containing all the possible excitation energies of the wavefunction model.
The rows are determined by the number of virtual orbitals, the columns by the number of occupied orbitals.
All the spin-orbital energies, with the alpha spin-orbital energies appearing before the beta spin-orbital energies.
All the spin-orbital energies, with the alpha and beta-spinorbital energies interleaved.
The orbital energies belonging to the virtual orbitals.
The orbital energies belonging to the occupied orbitals.
All the spatial orbital energies.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the orbital.

simplesect.para: The i-th orbital energy.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the singlet A stability matrix from the RHF stability conditions.

simplesect.para: The formula for the singlet A matrix is as follows: A_IAJB = \delta_IJ * (F_R)_BA - \delta_AB * (F_R)_IJ + 2 * (AI|JB) - (AB|JI).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'restricted' spin orbital basis of the RHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The singlet-A stability matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the singlet B stability matrix from the RHF stability conditions.

simplesect.para: The formula for the singlet B matrix is as follows: B_IAJB = 2 * (AI|BJ) - (AJ|BI).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'restricted' spin orbital basis of the RHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The singlet-B stability matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the triplet A stability matrix from the RHF stability conditions.

simplesect.para: The formula for the triplet A matrix is as follows: A_IAJB = \delta_IJ * (F_R)_BA - \delta_AB * (F_R)_IJ - (AB|JI).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'restricted' spin orbital basis of the RHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: the triplet-A stability matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the triplet B stability matrix from the RHF stability conditions.

simplesect.para: The formula for the triplet B matrix is as follows: B_IAJB = - (AJ|BI).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'restricted' spin orbital basis of the RHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The triplet-B stability matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF stability matrices and return them.

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'restricted' spin orbital basis of the RHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The RHF stability matrices.
The 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis related to these optimal RHF parameters.
The 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis related to these optimal RHF parameters.
The RHF 1-DM in the scalar/AO basis related to these optimal RHF parameters.
The RHF 1-DM in the scalar/AO basis related to these optimal RHF parameters.

parameterdescription.para: The number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The (spatial orbital, not spin-orbital) index of the RHF HOMO in an implicit orbital space.

parameterdescription.para: The number of spatial orbitals.
The number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The (spatial orbital, not spin-orbital) index of the RHF LUMO in an implicit orbital space.
The implicit occupied-virtual orbital space that is associated to these RHF model parameters.
The transformation that expresses the RHF MOs in terms of the underlying AOs.
The number of electron pairs that these RHF model parameters describe.
The total number of electrons that these RHF model parameters describe.

parameterdescription.para: The spin of the electrons (alpha or beta).

simplesect.para: The number of sigma-electrons that these RHF model parameters describe.
The number of spatial orbitals that these RHF model parameters describe.

memberdef.type: enable_if_t< std::is_same< Z, double >::value, Matrix< complex, Dynamic, 3 > >
memberdef.definition: enable_if_t< std::is_same< Z, double >::value, Matrix< complex, Dynamic, 3 > > GQCP::QCModel::RHF< _Scalar >::calculateMagneticFieldResponseForce
memberdef.name: calculateMagneticFieldResponseForce

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF response force for the perturbation due to a magnetic field.

parameterdescription.para: The angular momentum operator expressed in the RHF orbital basis.

simplesect.para: The RHF response force for the perturbation due to a magnetic field. Every column of the returned matrix contains the response force along the corresponding component: x, y, z.

memberdef.type: enable_if_t< std::is_same< Z, double >::value, Matrix< complex, Dynamic, 6 > >
memberdef.definition: enable_if_t< std::is_same< Z, double >::value, Matrix< complex, Dynamic, 6 > > GQCP::QCModel::RHF< _Scalar >::calculateGaugeOriginTranslationResponseForce
memberdef.name: calculateGaugeOriginTranslationResponseForce

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF response force for the perturbation due to a gauge origin translation of the magnetic field.

parameterdescription.para: The linear momentum operator expressed in the RHF orbital basis.

simplesect.para: The RHF response force for the perturbation due to a gauge origin translation of the magnetic field. Every column of the returned matrix contains the response force along the corresponding component: xy, xz, yx, yz, zx, zy.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Orbital1DM< Scalar > &D, const ScalarRSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &H_core, const ScalarRSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &F)
memberdef.name: calculateElectronicEnergy

parameterdescription.para: The RHF density matrix in a scalar basis.
The core Hamiltonian expressed in the same scalar basis.
The Fock matrix in the same scalar basis.

simplesect.para: The RHF electronic energy.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ScalarRSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &F, const Orbital1DM< Scalar > &D, const ScalarRSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &S)
memberdef.name: calculateError

parameterdescription.para: The Fock operator expressed in a scalar basis.
The RHF density matrix in the same scalar basis.
The overlap operator of that scalar basis.

simplesect.para: The RHF error matrix.

memberdef.definition: static enable_if_t< std::is_same< Z, double >::value, ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< complex > > GQCP::QCModel::RHF< _Scalar >::calculateOrbitalHessianForImaginaryResponse
memberdef.name: calculateOrbitalHessianForImaginaryResponse

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF orbital Hessian (H_RI -i H_II), which can be used as a response force constant when solving the CP(R)HF equations for a purely imaginary response.

parameterdescription.para: the Hamiltonian expressed in the canonical RHF orbital basis, resulting from a real optimization
the orbital space that encapsulates the occupied-virtual separation

simplesect.para: An RHF orbital Hessian.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spin-orbital basis.

parameterdescription.para: The number of spatial orbitals.
The total number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The RHF 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spin-orbital basis.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spin-orbital basis.

parameterdescription.para: The number of spatial orbitals.
The total number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The RHF 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spin-orbital basis.

parameterdescription.para: The coefficient matrix that expresses every spatial orbital (as a column) in its underlying scalar basis.
The number of electrons.

parameterdescription.para: The coefficient matrix that expresses every spatial orbital (as a column) in its underlying scalar basis.
The number of electrons.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the RHF Fock operator F = H_core + G, in which G is a contraction of the density matrix and the two-electron integrals.

The Hamiltonian expressed in the same scalar basis.

simplesect.para: The RHF Fock operator expressed in the scalar basis.

parameterdescription.para: The number of electrons.

The number of electrons.

The number of electrons.

memberdef.name: calculateIpsocentricMagneticInducibility

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the magnetic inducibility on the given point using the ipsocentric CSGT method.

parameterdescription.para: The point.
The RHF occupied-virtual separation.
The RHF linear response with respect to the magnetic field perturbation.
The RHF linear response with respect to the gauge origin translation perturbation.
The second-quantized representation of the field-free current density operator in the RHF orbital basis.

simplesect.para: The magnetic inducibility evaluated at the given point.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CubicGrid &grid, const OrbitalSpace &orbital_space, const Matrix< complex, Dynamic, 3 > &x_B, const Matrix< complex, Dynamic, 6 > &x_G, const VectorEvaluableRSQOneElectronOperator< CurrentDensityMatrixElement< complex, CartesianGTO > > &j_op)
memberdef.name: calculateIpsocentricMagneticInducibility

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the magnetic inducibility on the given grid using the ipsocentric CSGT method.

parameterdescription.para: The grid.
The RHF occupied-virtual separation.
The RHF linear response with respect to the magnetic field perturbation.
The RHF linear response with respect to the gauge origin translation perturbation.
The second-quantized representation of the field-free current density operator in the RHF orbital basis.

simplesect.para: The magnetic inducibility evaluated on the given grid.

detaileddescription.para: The restricted Hartree-Fock wave function model.

parameterdescription.para: The type of scalar that is used for the expansion of the spatial orbitals in their underlying scalar basis: real or complex.
